item.title: KE 3 – Irrigation Expert (Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review of the ‘Support to the implementation of the Agriculture Sector Wide Approach and Green Belt Initiative’

The overall objective of the mid-term review (MTR) is to provide the Government of Malawi and the European Union with an independent and reliable assessment of the performance of the support to the ASWAp (Malawi’s Agriculture Sector Wide Approach) and GBI (Green Belt Initiative) programme.

Project duration: 6 months

KE 3 – Irrigation Expert (Cat. I, 35 WD):

  • The irrigation expert should have at least a Master’s degree in irrigation engineering or civil engineering. A relevant postgraduate degree for this position will be favoured.
  • He/She must demonstrate at least 12 years of work experience in irrigation infrastructures development.
  • The expert will need to have relevant experience in at least 4 feasibility studies of irrigation projects.
  • He/She should present a strong knowledge and understanding of Irrigation and Agricultural water resources development and management.
  • He/She will demonstrate experience in implementing and/or evaluating Sustainable Agricultural Land and Water Management systems including the approaches related to catchment management.
  • Having experience with at least one (1) construction project or supervision contract financed by EU which will be an added advantage.
  • He/She should demonstrate appropriate communication skills to exchange and collect information with different irrigation actors (implementers and beneficiaries).
  • excellent skills in spoken and written English.

Globally, among the proposed team, there has to be a demonstrated experience of successful mainstreaming of the cross-cutting issues, especially gender and HIV-AIDS in development intervention.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: KE2 – Agricultural Development Expert (cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review of the ‘Support to the implementation of the Agriculture Sector Wide Approach and Green Belt Initiative’

The overall objective of the mid-term review (MTR) is to provide the Government of Malawi and the European Union with an independent and reliable assessment of the performance of the support to the ASWAp (Malawi’s Agriculture Sector Wide Approach) and GBI (Green Belt Initiative) programme.

Project duration: 6 months

KE2 – Agricultural Development Expert (cat. I, 30WD):

  • The expert should have at least a Master’s Degree in any discipline of agricultural sciences except agricultural economics which will be covered by the team leader (crop production, crop protection, agriculture extension, soil sciences).
  • He/She will have to demonstrate an overall professional experience of at least 7 years in the area of agriculture development and/or food security,
  • He/She should have experience in systems of agriculture research and extension under tropical conditions.
  • The expert should have experience in design, implementation and monitoring & evaluation of decentralized systems for agriculture extension.
  • He/She should demonstrate experience of at least 2 participations in teams in charge of monitoring and evaluation of agriculture and/or food security projects.
  • Experiences in implementation and/or monitoring of Trust funds supported projects will be an advantage,
  • He/She should present strong analytical skills of programmes in developing countries' agriculture.
  • He/She should demonstrate a good knowledge of maize based agricultural production systems.
  • He/She should have good capacity for data collection and analytical skills.
  • excellent skills in spoken and written English.

Globally, among the proposed team, there has to be a demonstrated experience of successful mainstreaming of the cross-cutting issues, especially gender and HIV-AIDS in development intervention.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Agricultural Development Specialist with M&E Experience (TL) (cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review of the ‘Support to the implementation of the Agriculture Sector Wide Approach and Green Belt Initiative’

The overall objective of the mid-term review (MTR) is to provide the Government of Malawi and the European Union with an independent and reliable assessment of the performance of the support to the ASWAp (Malawi’s Agriculture Sector Wide Approach) and GBI (Green Belt Initiative) programme.

Project duration: 6 months

Agricultural Development Specialist with M&E Experience (TL) (cat. I, 40 WD):

  • The team leader should have at least Master’s Degree in Agricultural Economics. Those with PhD will have an added advantage.
  • He/She will have to demonstrate an overall professional experience of at least 12 years in the area of agriculture and/or food security with a demonstrated good knowledge of developing countries.
  • He/She will have to demonstrate a good knowledge and experience of SWAp (design, implementation or monitoring and evaluation) for agriculture and/or food security in developing countries programme.
  • He/She must have extensive knowledge and experience in monitoring and evaluation of agricultural development projects.
  • The team leader must have an experience of EU procedures and aid modalities of at least 3 years.
  • Having experience in following up the implementation of at least one pool funding mechanism based project/programme in the agriculture sector will be an added advantage.
  • Sound knowledge of World Bank managed Trust funds will be considered as an advantage.
  • He/She must demonstrate managerial skills related to team leading position in implementation and/or monitoring and evaluation of development project.
  • The team leader must have good facilitation skills to organize workshops/seminars and to collect data from diverse stakeholders.
  • The team leader will demonstrate good reporting skills.
  • excellent skills in spoken and written English.

Globally, among the proposed team, there has to be a demonstrated experience of successful mainstreaming of the cross-cutting issues, especially gender and HIV-AIDS in development intervention.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Key Expert 4: Natural resources management specialist (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Feasibility study for extending the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme

The present contract aims to conduct a feasibility study for the extension of the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme, enabling inclusive growth in rural communities based on improved and sustainable use and management of water, soils and other natural resources. The global objective of the program is to contribute to Malawi’s Government objective of poverty reduction in line with the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). The specific objective of the program is to increase agricultural productivity and food security of rural communities. This will be done through the improvement of systems and processes, strengthening of implementation capacities and delivery of inputs to final beneficiaries.

Key Expert 4: Natural resources management specialist (Cat II) 50 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • At least a Masters Degree in Natural Resources Management or Environmental Management or equivalent. In its absence at least a Bachelors Degree with at least 7 years professional experience in carrying out identification- and feasibility studies for natural resources management projects.
  • Sound understanding of the context of irrigated agriculture.
  • Knowledge in water and terrestrial ecology.
  • Familiar with internationally recognised environmental safeguards, guidelines and recommendations.

*General professional experience *

Should have at least 6 years:

  • expertise in carrying out identification and feasibility studies for natural resources management projects.
  • Specialized in sustainable management of natural resources (land and water at basin or catchment or watershed level)
  • Professional experience in managing protected forest areas.
  • Experience in rural energy, including eventually charcoal production and (micro) hydropower will be an added advantage.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 3 years’ experience in implementing rural or agricultural or natural resources development programmes.
  • At least 3 years’ experience in environmental impact assessments (EIAs) applicable to water resources and irrigation projects. Knowledge of and experience with GoM environmental laws, acts and EIA guidelines will be an added advantage.
  • At least 1 year experience in implementing a component (within a rural development project) on integrated watershed management, on natural resources management or on rural energy development in relation to environmental protection and climate change resilience.
  • Successful teamwork during a minimum of 1 programme identification mission and 2 feasibility studies.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Expert 3: Social / Land tenure Specialist (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Feasibility study for extending the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme

The present contract aims to conduct a feasibility study for the extension of the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme, enabling inclusive growth in rural communities based on improved and sustainable use and management of water, soils and other natural resources. The global objective of the program is to contribute to Malawi’s Government objective of poverty reduction in line with the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). The specific objective of the program is to increase agricultural productivity and food security of rural communities. This will be done through the improvement of systems and processes, strengthening of implementation capacities and delivery of inputs to final beneficiaries.

Key Expert 3: Social / Land tenure Specialist (Cat II) 50 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • At least a Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Rural Sociology/Community Development/Rural Development or related fields, preferably with specialization in land tenure or assessment or administration. In its absence at least a Bachelors Degree with at least 7 years professional experience in managing or implementation of agricultural projects including land tenure or assessment or administration.
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of the context of irrigated agriculture.

General professional experience

Should have at least 6 years' experience in:

  • Managing or implementation of agricultural projects including land tenure or assessment or administration.
  • Farmer mobilization and in carrying out sociological surveys through participatory (rapid) rural appraisals (PRAs).
  • Working with Water User Associations and smallholder farmer groups / cooperatives.
  • Expertise in carrying out feasibility studies for agricultural development projects.
  • Experience in the collection, analysis and reporting of demographic data.

Specific professional experience

Demonstrated successful experience (internationally funded, preferably by the EU/EDF) of at least 6 years in participating in multidisciplinary teams for agricultural development (preferably irrigation) projects in developing countries.

Added advantage for having:

  • regularly carried out Social Impact Assessments (SIAs).
  • relevant international experience more specifically in Malawi with knowledge of local languages (Chichewa).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Key Expert 2: Agricultural Economist / Agribusiness Specialist (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Feasibility study for extending the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme

The present contract aims to conduct a feasibility study for the extension of the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme, enabling inclusive growth in rural communities based on improved and sustainable use and management of water, soils and other natural resources. The global objective of the program is to contribute to Malawi’s Government objective of poverty reduction in line with the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). The specific objective of the program is to increase agricultural productivity and food security of rural communities. This will be done through the improvement of systems and processes, strengthening of implementation capacities and delivery of inputs to final beneficiaries.

Key Expert 2: Agricultural Economist / Agribusiness Specialist (Cat II) – 70 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • At least a Masters Degree in Agriculture Economics with Agribusiness skills or equivalent. In its absence at least a Bachelors Degree with at least 7 years professional experience in carrying out identification and feasibility studies for irrigation projects.
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of the irrigation projects.
  • Computer skills with up to date knowledge of Economic Analysis applications.

General professional experience

Should have at least 6 year’s experience in:

  • carrying out identification and feasibility studies for irrigation projects.
  • economic and financial analyses.
  • collection, analysis and reporting of agricultural production and demographic data.
  • developing investment plans (including detailed costs) for irrigation / agriculture projects.
  • assessing markets and agro-processing requirements.
  • planning for and actually develop farmer associations and/or cooperatives.
  • irrigated agriculture.

Specific professional experience

Demonstrated successful experience (internationally funded, preferably by the EU/EDF) of at least:

  • 6 years in identification and feasibility studies of agricultural development projects (including institutional as well as economic and financial analyses).
  • 1 identification mission to develop an irrigation project.
  • 1 feasibility study to develop an irrigation project.
  • 2 years’ experience in commercial agriculture, agro-processing and market development.

Added advantage for having experience in:

  • socio-economic surveys through rapid rural appraisals.
  • contract farming models.
  • crops and cropping patterns in the project area.
  • irrigation agronomy.
  • managing food security and drought risk.
  • participatory design of irrigated farming systems.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Key Expert 1: Team Leader - Irrigation Specialist (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Feasibility study for extending the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme

The present contract aims to conduct a feasibility study for the extension of the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme, enabling inclusive growth in rural communities based on improved and sustainable use and management of water, soils and other natural resources. The global objective of the program is to contribute to Malawi’s Government objective of poverty reduction in line with the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). The specific objective of the program is to increase agricultural productivity and food security of rural communities. This will be done through the improvement of systems and processes, strengthening of implementation capacities and delivery of inputs to final beneficiaries.

Key Expert 1: Team Leader - Irrigation Specialist (Cat I) – 74 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • At least a Masters Degree or equivalent in Civil/ Irrigation/ Agricultural engineering or equivalent. In its absence at least a Bachelors Degree with 15 years professional experience in carrying out feasibility studies and detailed designs for Irrigation/drainage/agriculture projects.
  • Full working knowledge of computer software commonly used in feasibility studies with irrigation / drainage infrastructures.
  • Knowledge of irrigation water requirements and drainage modules / flood alleviation.

General professional experience

Should have at least 12 years' experience in:

  • Conducting as Team Leader identification standard preliminary design and feasibility studies for irrigation / drainage / agriculture projects with demonstrated project management skills.
  • Irrigation and Agricultural water resources development and management at basin-level.
  • Sustainable Agricultural Land and Water Management.
  • Design, construction, supervision and / or operation & maintenance (O&M) of irrigation schemes
  • Developing Irrigation Water User Associations (WUAs).

Specific professional experience

Demonstrated successful experience {internationally funded, preferably by the EU/European Development Fund (EDF)} of at least:

  • 10 years in identifying, designing and implementing rural development projects in general.
  • 3 years in feasibility studies of irrigation /drainage projects.
  • 3 feasibility studies as Team Leader of at least 300,000 EUR in total out of which at least one (1) was to develop an irrigation / drainage project.
  • hydrological analysis of water resources for irrigation purposes.
  • standard preliminary design for at least 1 dam and 1 bulk water structure (for large scale schemes).
  • 1 geo-technical survey.
  • 1 construction project or supervision contract (this would be an added advantage).
  • Added advantage for working knowledge of engineering software {such as in AutoCAD systems for designing irrigation systems, Geo Information System (GIS), etc}.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Expert in Governance/ Public Finance Management (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Governance and Public finances Management Sector Review to Mongolia

The global objective of the assignment is to undertake a review of the Governance sector (for this assignment the scope of the term governance will focus on public sector reform, management of public finances and civil service reform) in Mongolia that will provide information for an implementation strategy for the EU in the Governance sector.

Specific objectives

The specific objectives of the assignment are:

  • To assess previous Governance sector strategies and reforms in Mongolia, identifying the main obstacles that hindered the achievement of development outcomes.
  • To assess the Governance sector performance and policies, identifying the main challenges and opportunities for the new Government to carry out successful reforms and policies in this sector.
  • To carry out a risk analysis for budget support operations in the country
  • To identify areas of intervention and aid delivery methods with its pros and cons, for the EU development cooperation in the Governance sector for the period 2017-2020.

Expert in Governance/ Public Finance Management (Cat. II)

Education

  • University degree in Law, Political science, Economy, sociology and/or equivalent proven professional experience of at least 6 years related fields.
  • Education at advanced degree would be an asset.

Minimum required professional and technical skills:

  • Profound knowledge and experience of at least 6 years in good governance projects and /or public finances management.
  • Work experience in at least 3 international cooperation projects in the field of governance and public finances management.

The following professional and technical skills would be an advantage:

  • Work experience in public sector reform in Mongolia.
  • Good knowledge of Mongolian public administration.
  • Work experience in public finances management in Mongolia.
  • Work experience in Mineral wealth management in Mongolia.

Communication skills:

  • Strong analytical skills are required
  • Very good communication skills
  • Very good drafting skills

Language skills:

  • Expert must be proficient in English and Mongolian.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: M&E Expert (Cat.II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Local Economic Development Programme (ProDEL): M&E Expert

The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows:

ProDEL´s overall objective is to contribute to poverty reduction through income generation and employment opportunities in the rural areas of Mozambique. The purpose is to promote the economic development in the rural areas of Gaza, Inhambane and Sofala Provinces, by strengthening the productive base and the competitiveness of local micro, small and medium enterprises.

M&E Expert (Cat.II)

Qualification and skills

  • University degree in development studies, project planning and management, geography, sociology, or other related discipline relevant to the assignment.
  • Ability to communicate with programme stakeholders in Portuguese and English.

General professional experience

  • Minimum of 6 years work experience, including M&E related to rural development. Specific professional experience
  • Experience in the design and implementation of M&E systems, preferably for rural development programmes involving the public sector.
  • Experience with data collection and analysis (quantitative and qualitative data), statistics.
  • Experience in conducting training sessions, including facilitation skills.
  • Very strong planning, system development and organizational skills, including results- orientation.
  • Excellent analytical skills.
  • Good understanding of change management concepts and approaches.
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to undertake field visits.
  • Fully proficient in the following software applications: Word, Excel, and Power point.

Strong advantage / highly desirable:

  • Previous work experience in advisory positions and/or capacity development related including the public sector in developing countries.
  • Experience with modern technologies/IT solutions.

  • Relevant in country experience in Mozambique, preferably including:

  • design and implementation of M&E systems for preferably rural, economic, or agriculture development programmes;

  • knowledge and familiarity with national statistics and alternative data sources;

  • experience with primary data collection.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Legal Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
EEM Haiti 2016

The objectives of the mission are the following:

  • Assess and evaluate all aspects of the electoral process in Haiti, and make recommendations in the area of electoral reform;
  • Assess the implementation of previous EU (and non-EU) election related mission’s recommendations and propose targeted recommendations the authorities of Haiti should take in order to improve the election framework;
  • Identify needs and potential for additional bilateral or EU electoral assistance programmes;

Senior Legal Expert (Cat. I, approx. 90 WD):

Qualifications and Skills

  • Education at least Master’s Degree Academic level in Political Science, International Relations, Law or any other discipline relevant to the assignment. In its absence, equivalent professional experience (more than 12 years).

General Professional Experience

  • At least 12 years of experience in the area related to Lot 7.

Specific Professional Experience

  • At least 5 years work experience in the field of electoral assistance and electoral observation and analysis, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an Election Technical Assistance project of the EU or of other international organisations, possibly including managing an electoral observation mission, drafting statements and reports;
  • S/he must have previously been directly involved in the organisation of election observation by the EU or other organisations with the participation in at least 3 election observation missions with international or domestic organisations. Those can include: Election Observation Missions (Core Team positions), Election Assessment Team (expert position), Election Expert Mission (expert position), Exploratory Mission (expert position), Needs Assessment Missions (expert position).
  • Familiarity with the legal and regulatory framework for the elections as well as international and regional standards for elections. In this context the “Compendium of International Standards for Elections” is an important background document;
  • Proven work experience on electoral legislation and good understanding of election dispute resolution systems;
  • Excellent understanding of the functioning of election management bodies;
  • Experience in assessing the media landscape and media framework, according to international and regional standards, particularly as regards to elections, will be an asset;
  • Previous experience in the country and/or the region and good networks within the different sectors of society in order to be immediately operational will be an asset.

Language skills Excellent written and spoken French.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Organisational Development Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to consolidate the scope for the NSG Enterprise Architecture

Global objective

The global objective is to further develop the ICT capability of the NSG in delivering training and development programmes efficiently and effectively. This objective will contribute to a professional public service that delivers quality services.

*Specific objective(s) *

The specific objective of this assignment, of which these Terms of Reference (ToR) will be part of, is to consolidate into one comprehensive project scope all the elements of the Enterprise Architecture into one solid Terms of Reference for the Public Service Training and Capacity Building Programme in accordance with the EU Restricted Procedures for service contracts.

Organisational Development Expert

General Professional Experience

  • A minimum of 6 years' experience and knowledge of Organisational Development preferably in South Africa.
  • Knowledge and experience in business process mapping and design in the context of public service learning/training
  • Extensive experience in ICT strategy design, development and implementation for the higher education sector evidenced by experience at least in 2 projects.

At least one of the experts must have demonstrable knowledge of EU contractual/procurement procedures either through programme/project design/preparation, management or implementation most notably of Restricted Procedures for service contracts.

The experts must sign a declaration of objectivity and confidentiality, annex A3 of the PRAG.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Enterprise Architecture Expert in Education, Training and Development Sector (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to consolidate the scope for the NSG Enterprise Architecture

Global objective

The global objective is to further develop the ICT capability of the NSG in delivering training and development programmes efficiently and effectively. This objective will contribute to a professional public service that delivers quality services.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objective of this assignment, of which these Terms of Reference (ToR) will be part of, is to consolidate into one comprehensive project scope all the elements of the Enterprise Architecture into one solid Terms of Reference for the Public Service Training and Capacity Building Programme in accordance with the EU Restricted Procedures for service contracts.

*Senior Enterprise Architecture Expert in Education, Training and Development Sector (Cat.I) *

Qualification & Skills

  • A Masters’ Degree or an equivalent qualification in Information & Communication Technology (ICT) or equivalent,
  • In the absence of a Master’s Degree, a Bachelor’s Degree or an equivalent qualification in Information & Communication Technology or equivalent, will be considered with at least 15 years' experience in the fields listed above
  • Enterprise Architecture certification and/or Governance of Enterprise IT certification or IT certification or equivalent would be an added advantage

General Professional Experience

  • A minimum of 12 years' experience and extensive knowledge of Enterprise Architecture design, development and implementation in the Education, Training and Development sector
  • Familiarity with the Government Wide Enterprise Architecture (GWEA), and related frameworks would be an added advantage.
  • Knowledge and experience in designing ICT tools and systems in the context of higher education sector
  • Extensive experience in ICT strategy design, development and implementation for the higher education sector evidenced by experience at least in 2 projects.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description: Evaluer l'impact des projets de jumelages réalisés au Maroc en termes de renforcement de la capacité administrative et technique des administrations concernées et de odernisation de leur organisation.

item.title: Expert/e en Évaluation de Programmes de Développement et de Cooperation
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation de l'impact des Projets de Jumelages Instituionnels Rerealises au Maroc

Evaluer l'impact des projets de jumelages réalisés au Maroc en termes de renforcement de la capacité administrative et technique des administrations concernées et de odernisation de leur organisation.

*Expert/e en Évaluation de Programmes de Développement et de Cooperation *

  • Exigence minimale : Diplôme d'enseignement supérieur de niveau Master (bac +5) en sciences politiques, sciences économiques, sciencesjuridiques/ droit ou domaine équivalent, ou en cas d'absence de diplôme une expérience professionnelle de minimum 17 années.
  • Exigence minimale : Très bonne maîtrise de la langue française parlée et écrite.
  • Exigence minimale: 12 année en matière d'évaluation de programmes de développement et de coopération,dont au moins 2 ans à l'international dans des pays d'un niveau de développement similaire au Maroc.
  • Exigence minimale: * Expérience de l'évaluation d'au moins 3 programmes de renforcement de capacités institutionnelles d'administrations publiques comme exigence minimale;
  • Expérience en matière d'instruments de coopération pour le renforcement de capacités institutionnelles;
  • Expérience fortement souhaitable des instruments: jumelage institutionnel, TAIEX et SIGMA;
  • Expérience dans un pays ou ex-pays candidat à l'adhésion à l'UE souhaitable;
  • Expérience en matière de coordination de mission pour assurer la fonction de chef de mission souhaitable. • Atout: Connaissance des procédures UE pour les instruments de jumelage institutionnel et assistance technique. • Exigence minimale : Très bonne maîtrise de la langue française parlée et écrite

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: AWP 2 Projects Review
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
The Beyond WTO Program (B-WTO) was developed in response to a request from the Government of Vietnam (GoV) for donor support to help with managing economic integration and the transition to a market economy following WTO accession. The B-WTO goal is “to strengthen government’s capacity to manage the integration of Vietnam into the global economy and the transition of Vietnam to a socialist market economy”. The immediate objective is “implementation of priority policy actions from the GoV’s Action Plan to enhance Vietnam’s capacity to sustain pro-poor growth (GAP)”.

The remit of this project was a review of the 2nd annual work plan’s implementation (AWP2) of Phase 2 of the B-WTO in May 2013. The objectives of the review were to:

  • Evaluate the project implementation performance and project results relative to the logical framework targets and evaluation criteria.
  • Evaluate the results achieved at the Component and Program’s level according to the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework of the Program.
  • Identify lessons learned from implementation, make recommendations for the remaining duration of the program and the Independent Completion Report process.

item.title: Health Program M&E
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
In partnership with the Ministry of Health (MoH), the Australian Government is scoping and piloting a new approach to engagement in the health sector in Timor-Leste. The program approach is innovative in several respects. Key program features are: a systems perspective; joint program oversight by MoH and Australian Government; an emphasis on capacity facilitation through coaching rather than an over-reliance on more traditional technical assistance approaches; ongoing processes of joint intervention design throughout implementation; and rapid cycles of evidence-informed adaptation. These will require significant investments in interactive, exploratory, and rigorous monitoring and evaluation, requiring support from an M&E Specialist that is comfortable with non-traditional M&E approaches.

The Health Program M&E Specialist worked with the Australian Government Timor-Leste Health Team to design an M&E system for Australia’s support to the health sector, that is aligned with the Ministry of Health’s draft Sector M&E Framework and consistent with Australian Aid Program M&E Standards. The primary purpose of the M&E System will be to support strategic management and ongoing improvement of the Australian Government - MoH partnership in the health sector.
